text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The response explicitly addresses the incorporation of domestic law into the jurisdictional analysis under the section 'III. Applicable Law to Counterclaims'. It discusses the competing approaches, noting that the modern trend (Approach 3) allows tribunals to apply domestic law (like environmental obligations) if there is a sufficient nexus, even if the jurisdiction is anchored in the BIT. It further confirms this trend in the context of environmental counterclaims, citing *Perenco v. Ecuador* where the tribunal applied Ecuadorian environmental law to assess damages. This directly satisfies the criterion regarding mentioning applicable law incorporation (domestic environmental obligations integrated through analogous custom/nexus).", "criterion_id": "b21bb6a4-a9dd-4787-83a9-afdb78d12f8e"}
